DataElement.preferredName: Attenuated Live Virus Vaccine Immunization 30 Day Prior First Therapy Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to signify whether a patient has been vaccinated with a live vaccine within 30 days of receiving the first dose of clinical trial treatment.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Attenuated Live Virus Vaccine Immunization Integer::30 Day Prior First Therapy
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Live vaccines prepared from microorganisms which have undergone physical adaptation (e.g., by radiation or temperature conditioning) or serial passage in laboratory animal hosts or infected tissue/cell cultures, in order to produce avirulent mutant strains capable of inducing protective immunity. Live-attenuated vaccines are used when a CD8+ T Cell (cellular cytotoxicity) response is desired._A technique used to cause an immune response that results in resistance to a specific disease, especially an infectious disease._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::30_The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day._Earlier in time or order._Preceding all others in time or space or degree._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Live vaccines prepared from microorganisms which have undergone physical adaptation (e.g., by radiation or temperature conditioning) or serial passage in laboratory animal hosts or infected tissue/cell cultures, in order to produce avirulent mutant strain:A technique used to cause an immune response that results in resistance to a specific disease, especially an infectious disease.

Concepts.definition: Live vaccines prepared from microorganisms which have undergone physical adaptation (e.g., by radiation or temperature conditioning) or serial passage in laboratory animal hosts or infected tissue/cell cultures, in order to produce avirulent mutant strains capable of inducing protective immunity. Live-attenuated vaccines are used when a CD8+ T Cell (cellular cytotoxicity) response is desired.
Inoculating an individual with either killed or live agents to prevent contraction of a disease.

Property.preferredDefinition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::30:The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.:Earlier in time or order.:Preceding all others in time or space or degree.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.
Preceding all others in time or space or degree.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has received a live vaccine w
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has received a live vaccine within 30 days prior to the first dose of trial treatment

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient received live attenuated vaccination within 30 days prior to study entry or within 30 days of receiving immunotherapy

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had a live, attenuated vaccine within 28 days prior to randomization?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CITN-1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has received a live vaccine within 30 days prior to the first dose of trial treatment. Examples of live vaccines include, but are not limited to, the following: measles, mumps, rubella, chicken pox, yellow fever, seasonal flu (some), H1N1 flu, rabies, BCG, and typhoid vaccine.  Seasonal flu vaccines that do not contain live virus are permitted.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Received live vaccine within 30 days prior to registration?
